FuncDef:
The mirroring observe-port command configures VLAN mirroring.
The undo mirroring command deletes VLAN mirroring configuration. The mirroring observe-port command configures VLAN mirroring. The undo mirroring command deletes VLAN mirroring configuration. By default, VLAN mirroring is not configured.
CLIs: mirroring observe-port { <observe-port-index> | group <group-id> } { inbound | outbound | both }
undo mirroring [ observe-port { <observe-port-index> | group <group-id> } ] { inbound | outbound | both }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the index of an observing port group.
For the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ:The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 128.
For the CE6885-LL (low latency mode):The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 8.

Indicates that mirroring is configured for the incoming traffic in the VLAN.
-

Indicates that mirroring is configured for the outgoing traffic in the VLAN.
-

Indicates that mirroring is configured for the incoming and outgoing traffic in the VLAN.
-

Specifies the index of an observing port.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 8.

ExtraInfo: Users can use the mirroring observe-port command to mirror the traffic on all active ports in a specified VLAN to an observing port. Users can also run the mirroring observe-port group command to mirror the traffic to an observing port group so that the packets are copied to all the member ports of the observing port group.
